title: 114_hr5770
content: The Act titled "Department of Veterans Affairs Dental Insurance Reauthorization Act of 2016" establishes a dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents of veterans. The Department of Veterans Affairs Dental Insurance Reauthorization Act of 2016 establishes a dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents of veterans under section 1712C of title 38, United States Code. The plan covers enrolled veterans and their eligible family members. The Department of Veterans Affairs Dental Insurance Reauthorization Act of 2016 establishes a dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents. The plan covers enrolled veterans under section 1705 and eligible family members under section 1781 for medical care. The Secretary will contract with a dental insurer to administer the plan, providing appropriate benefits for dental care and treatment. The dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents will provide benefits such as diagnostic, preventative, restorative, surgical, and emergency services. Enrollment in the plan is voluntary for a minimum period set by the Secretary, and premiums will cover all associated costs. The dental insurance plan under this section will cover all costs, with premiums adjusted annually. Individuals must pay the full premium and copayments. Voluntary disenrollment is allowed. The dental insurance plan requires individuals to pay the full premium and copayments. Voluntary disenrollment is allowed within a 30-day period of enrollment, and under circumstances prescribed by the Secretary. The dental insurance plan allows voluntary disenrollment within 30 days of enrollment under circumstances prescribed by the Secretary to prevent misuse of benefits or due to a serious medical condition. The dental insurance plan allows voluntary disenrollment within 30 days of enrollment under certain circumstances, including serious medical conditions or as prescribed by the Secretary. The Secretary will establish procedures for determining the permissibility of disenrollments to ensure timely decisions. This does not affect the Secretary's responsibility for providing dental care. The dental insurance plan allows voluntary disenrollment under specific circumstances, with procedures established by the Secretary to determine permissibility. Participation in the plan does not affect entitlement to outpatient dental services under section 1712. The plan will be administered according to regulations set by the Secretary and will terminate on December 31, 2021. The dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents is established, with a termination date of December 31, 2021. Section 510 of the Caregivers and Veterans Omnibus Health Services Act of 2010 is repealed.
